Dragonfly Partner: Ethereum and Solana Are More Like Two Facebooks

On December 24, Dragonfly general partner Rob Hadick said in an interview with CNBC's Squawk Box that as asset tokenization accelerates and on-chain economic activity continues to expand, a single blockchain is unlikely to support an entire ecosystem. Instead, Ethereum and Solana are expected to develop in parallel across different use cases. He noted that Ethereum currently hosts most stablecoins and core economic activity, while Solana has advantages in high-frequency trading and transaction efficiency, describing the two networks as more like two Facebooks.

Source: https://t.co/roQUoFqjFV

Mirae Asset Group is in talks to acquire Korbit, South Korea's fourth-largest cryptocurrency exchange by volume, in a deal valued at roughly 100 billion to 140 billion Korean won ($70 million to $100 million), according to a Sunday report from The Chosun Daily.  The potential acquisition would be led by Mirae Asset Consulting, a non-financial affiliate of the group, which has signed a memorandum of understanding with Korbit's major shareholders, per the report. Korbit is primarily owned by NXC, the holding company for gaming giant Nexon, which controls about 60.5% of shares. SK Planet holds an additional 31.5% stake following a 90 billion won investment in 2021.  Founded in 2013, Korbit was South Korea's first crypto exchange and the world's first Bitcoin $BTC  -Korean won trading platform. Despite its early-mover status, the exchange currently commands less than 1% of domestic trading volume, according to CoinGecko data. In the past 24 hours, Upbit has dominated the market with more than $716 million in daily volume, followed by Bithumb at roughly $298 million. $SOL

Global infrastructure isnâ€™t built from a desk.

In 2025, @GEODNET went where the physical world moves, and where the future of automation is being shaped.

We started in Las Vegas at CES, putting real-time RTK precision in front of the worldâ€™s largest tech audience. Robots, vehicles, and autonomous systems operating live - showing that centimeter accuracy isnâ€™t theoretical anymore. 

From there, we met the Web3 builders redefining infrastructure at TOKEN2049. Conversations shifted from ideas to deployment. 

Back in Las Vegas for Commercial UAV Expo, we showed how global RTK changes drone operations - more reliable missions, better data, fewer compromises. Precision became practical.

In the fall, we joined the geospatial community at Intergeo in Frankfurt, connecting with surveyors and GIS professionals who rely on accuracy every day. Decentralized GNSS wasnâ€™t a concept, but it was already working, globally.

We closed the year at Solana Breakpoint in Abu Dhabi, where location-aware applications and real-world DePIN took center stage. The physical world is coming on-chain, and it needs infrastructure that works everywhere.

Looking back this defining year, GEODNET didnâ€™t just present a vision. We demonstrated it.

Global network.
Global presence.
Infrastructure built in the real world.

ğŸ¬Watch the 2025 journey of GEODNET. We are just getting started.

ğŸš€ EXD MIGRATION â€” FINAL STAGE (WALLETS)

Over the past few days, we have shared with the community each stage of the EXD migration process to the Solana network.

â˜‘ï¸ New contract created on Solana
â˜‘ï¸ Mint and Freeze functions revoked
â˜‘ï¸ Token made immutable with fixed supply
â˜‘ï¸ Automatic migration completed for tokens on the EADX Exchange
â˜‘ï¸ Deposits and withdrawals already enabled on the Solana network
We are now entering the final stage of the migration.

ğŸ“ Migration for wallet holders (MetaMask, Trust Wallet, etc.)
This phase is intended exclusively for holders who keep EXD in external wallets.

For this purpose, we have made available the official form, which will allow a 1:1 conversion to the Solana network.

Address of the project for sending the tokens.

ğŸ“Œ Important points: 

â€¢ Tokens on the EADX Exchange have already been migrated automatically
â€¢ Tokens in external wallets must follow this process
â€¢ After the start of this phase, purchases made in the Polygon pool will not be eligible for migration

ğŸŸ¢ How to buy EXD now
It is important to reinforce:

ğŸ‘‰ Trading of EXD within the EADX Exchange continues normally.

The tokens traded on the EADX Exchange are already 100% on the Solana network, which means:
â€¢ You can buy and sell EXD normally
â€¢ Deposits and withdrawals are already active on the Solana network
â€¢ Withdrawals can be made directly to Phantom, Solflare, or any Solana-compatible wallet
In other words, there is no market interruption within the EADX Exchange.

Those who wish to position themselves now can do so directly through the exchange, already in the new environment.

ğŸŒ Liquidity and the new cycle

The Polygon pool will be deactivated.

The liquidity will be reallocated and incorporated, together with the strategic buyback of US$ 1,000 to US$ 1,500, for the opening of the new pool on Raydium (Solana).

We are positioning EXD in an ecosystem with greater traction, liquidity, and visibility, preparing the governance token for the next growth cycles.

â³ Limited supply.

We continue to move forward, with execution, clarity, and strategic vision.

Two weeks ago, Bittensor successfully completed its first halving. Now, as emissions adjust and the network reshapes incentives, several subnets are emerging as ones to watch.

Spotlight on Synth: the predictive intelligence subnet launched by @modenetwork, building high-fidelity synthetic price data for forecasting.

In its early stages, the network's demonstrating its worth followingğŸ‘‡

~~ Analysis by @davewardonline ~~

I, like many others, am mesmerized by the predictive potential of AI and have taken stabs at testing out different products that claimed to have achieved this goal. Infinite Games' predictive agent Aeon â€“ I lost money. Taoshi's signals â€“ I made money, then I lost money.

I share these to demonstrate that many teams have driven towards predictive intelligence using decentralized AI. Obviously achieving this would be a goldmine, but it also feeds the hunger we all have to gaze into the crystal ball.

While these are "selfish" motivations, I'll put forth a more "selfless" one borrowed from nof1's recent article: these "unpredictable" financial environments produce a better benchmark to test AI against. AI now scores in top percentiles in coding, reasoning, writing, and math olympiads â€” all controlled environments that can be memorized, pattern-matched, or gamed through training data. Real-world environments like markets cannot, or at least are much more difficult to.

This was the impetus for @the_nof1 creating Alpha Arena, a trading competition where LLMs were provided portions of $320K to trade with. (Most have failed horribly, though Grok's has posted some nice returns.)

And while many teams are building toward predictive intelligence, very few have demonstrated success. Though, so far, Synthdata has and is continuing to, which is why I'm diving deeper.

What Synthdata Actually Does

Synthdata is a decentralized network for predictive financial intelligence. Miners compete to model uncertainty for short-term price movements across assets â€” BTC, ETH, SOL, XAU (gold) â€” and that modeling feeds downstream applications: options pricing, liquidation probabilities, liquidity provision strategies.

Validators continuously send requests asking miners questions like, "Where might BTC be over the next hour?" Each miner independently generates 1,000 possible price paths, minute by minute. Some show price going up, some down, most landing somewhere in between.

The key mechanic: miners do not assign probabilities to paths. Each path carries equal weight. Probability emerges from how many paths land in a given outcome. If 620 of 1,000 paths end higher than the starting point, that implies 62% odds of Up. No miner declared "62% confident" â€” that number fell out of the simulation. This design prevents confidence manipulation and forces honest uncertainty modeling.

There's no single "Synth model." There's an open competition, with miners free to use whatever approach captures real price behavior best.

How Miners Are Judged

Miners aren't judged immediately or on profit. They're judged after reality happens, by validators, using CRPS (Continuous Ranked Probability Score) â€” a method for evaluating how well someone modeled uncertainty, not whether they guessed right.

CRPS penalizes three failures: being wrong (reality far from most paths), being overconfident (paths too tight, reality outside), and being vague (paths spread everywhere "just in case"). You cannot game it by always being confident, always being vague, or getting lucky once.

Scores feed into a leaderboard where recent performance matters more than old. Rewards flow to miners reliably honest about the uncertainty of outcomes.

Proving It Out on Polymarket

To demonstrate the system works, Synthdata runs a public @Polymarket account trading the BTC Hourly Up/Down market.

Synth already has implied odds from its paths. If 620 of 1,000 end higher, that's 62% implied probability of Up. Say Polymarket prices Up at 55 cents (implying 55%). Synth sees a gap â€” its models suggest 62%, the market says 55% â€” so it buys Up. Not because it knows BTC will rise, but because it knows the odds are mispriced.

Using this method, it has turned $3K into $73K.

What This Points Toward

The Polymarket account serves as a compelling proof of concept for the network's broader vision of predictive financial intelligence.

Of course, questions remain. Going from $3K to $73K is astoundingly impressive, but the sample size is limited. Edges erode. What works in one regime may fail in another. Polymarket's hourly markets prove much thinner than larger markets like 0DTE options which Synth looks to support (though it hasn't established a similar account-based proof of concept for, to my knowledge.)

Still, the system design is compelling and, personally, feels more sustainable than those providing "long/short" signals. Whether it matures into something durable or burns out like others remains to be seen. But Synthdata has receipts, and that alone makes it worth watching.

SOLANA RISKS BEARISH REVERSAL AFTER MULTIYEAR DOUBLE TOP AS PRICE, TVL AND FEES DECLINE


Solana (SOL) has slid ~12% this month to about $127.7, trading over 48% below its September peak. Weekly charts show a multiyear double-top with a neckline near $120 â€” a break below $120 would likely confirm a bearish reversal toward the April low near $95, while a sustained move above $155 would invalidate the pattern. On-chain demand and institutional interest have weakened: DeFi TVL on Solana fell from $35.1B to $23.8B, protocol fees dropped from $31M to $8M, and spot SOL ETF inflows declined from $199.2M in the first week after launch to $13.1M last week. $SOL #SOL #Solana

FLOW dropped over 12% after news of a security incident, shaking confidence across the ecosystem. The sell-off shows how fragile sentiment can be when security concerns hit core infrastructure.

But history says recovery is possible. Projects that respond quickly with transparency, audits, and compensation plans often rebuild trust over time. Solana ( $SOL), for example, bounced back after multiple outages once reliability improved and developers stayed focused on growth.

For FLOW, the path forward likely depends on:

Clear post-mortem + fixes

Third-party audits

Support for affected users

Consistent network stability going forward

Answer: Yes price and trust can be restored, but only if FLOW handles the aftermath openly and proves the network is safer than before. Until then, volatility is likely to stay elevated.

$SOL  Monthly Returns Heatmap What Smart Money Watches ğŸ“Š

This heatmap tells a clear story most traders ignore. $SOL has historically delivered its strongest moves after periods of mixed or negative months, not during obvious hype phases. Red months have often acted as accumulation zones, while clusters of green months signal momentum expansion.

What stands out is consistency. When $SOL flips structure after a weak stretch, upside follow-through tends to be aggressive and fast. This behavior favors patient positioning over chasing candles.

For traders, the edge is timing â€” aligning entries during compression phases and reducing exposure after extended green runs. For investors, it reinforces one thing: volatility works for disciplined holders, not against them.

Track the cycle, not emotions.

The $FLOW hack and the double digit crash that followed are a harsh reminder that in crypto, trust is just as important as price. When a security breach happens, charts donâ€™t just react to selling pressure they react to confidence leaving the room. Can $FLOW recover? Yes, but only if transparency and execution come first. The team needs to clearly explain what happened, how funds are protected, and whatâ€™s being fixed. Price can always bounce, but trust takes longer to rebuild.


In the short term volatility will stay high as traders compare $FLOW risk profile to stronger narratives like $SOL or $AVAX, which are benefiting from ecosystem growth and consistent developer activity.


If #FLOW delivers fast security upgrades and shows real onchain recovery the market will eventually reprice it. If communication stalls liquidity will keep rotating out. Bottom line recovery is possible, but it wonâ€™t be instant trust must lead before price follows.

#Solana  is trading near the lower end of its recent range after a prolonged downtrend from the highs, with price currently hovering around the $120 region. 

The chart highlights a clear demand zone below current levels, where price has previously reacted and shown signs of buyer interest. 

While overall structure remains bearish in the short term, this area could serve as a base for a potential relief bounce. On the upside, multiple overhead resistance levels remain intact, suggesting any recovery may face selling pressure unless supported by strong momentum. 

For now,  $SOL appears to be in a consolidation phase, with market participants closely watching reactions around key demand for confirmation of the next directional move.
